physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It features five individuals
 standing over a table. Two men are dressed in a suit
 two others on the right are dressed in a shirt
 and the woman dressed in a dress. On the table
 there is an opened frame box. A man is placing something into the frame casing. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.

sgcool_label_text:George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year
 Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1
620 schoolchildren. This photograph album
 with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover
 was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.

metadata.title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of group standing over table
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features five individuals, standing over a table. Two men are dressed in a suit, two others on the right are dressed in a shirt, and the woman dressed in a dress. On the table, there is an opened frame box. A man is placing something into the frame casing. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008
metadata.sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
